description: Borrowed from Middle French ressource, from Old French resourse, resource (“a source, spring”), from resourdre, from Latin resurgō (“to rise again, spring up anew”). Equivalent to re- +‎ source. See resourd, resurgent, source.

entries.meaning: Something that one uses to achieve an objective, e.g. raw materials or personnel.
A person's capacity to deal with difficulty.
examples: a man or woman of resource

entries.meaning: Something that can be used to help achieve an aim, especially a book, equipment, etc. that provides information for teachers and students.
(networking) Hardware or software accessible by a computer, network, or another object connected to a computer.

verbs.description: resource (third-person singular simple present resources, present participle resourcing, simple past and past participle resourced)
resource (third-person singular simple present resources, present participle resourcing, simple past and past participle resourced)

entries.meaning: To source anew or differently; to find or provide a new source for.
